DataElement.preferredName: Patient Lesser Control Diabetes Mellitus Eligibility Determination Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services based on poorly controlled diabetes.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Lesser Control Diabetes Mellitus Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services based on poorly controlled diabetes.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Lesser Control Diabetes Mellitus Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: Of lower rank, degree, or importance; of reduced size, extent, or degree; more limited in quantity.:The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.:(dye-a-BEE-teez) A disease in which the body does not properly control the amount of sugar in the blood. As a result, the level of sugar in the blood is too high. This disease occurs when the body does not produce enough insulin or does not use it properly.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: Of lower rank, degree, or importance; of reduced size, extent, or degree; more limited in quantity.
The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.
A metabolic disorder characterized by abnormally high blood sugar levels due to diminished production of insulin or insulin resistance/desensitization.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have poorly
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have poorly controlled diabetes?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have poorly controlled diabetes mellitus?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have unstable diabetes mellitus?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ACRIN 6685
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have poorly controlled diabetes (defined as fasting glucose level > 200 mg/dL) despite attempts to improve glucose control by fasting duration and adjustment of medications?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of hospitalization in the past 12 months for diabetic ketoacidosis (DKA) or hyperosmolar hyperglycemic nonketoic syndrome (NHNS)

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient suffered from uncontrolled diabetes?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text_5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient diabetic (Type I or Type II diabetes mellitus)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of poorly controlled diabetes?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have diabetes either requiring insulin therapy or with a baseline fasting glucose greater than or equal to 160 mg/dL and/or high HbA1c (greater than 8), suggesting poorly controlled diabetes?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have uncontrolled Type I or II diabetes mellitus?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have diabetes either requiring insulin therapy or with a baseline fasting glucose greater than 160 mg/dL and/or high HbA1c (greater than 8), suggesting poorly controlled diabetes?
